intro: Portulaca pilosa var. marginata, commonly known as the marginspot purslane, is a low-growing, succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It features fleshy, ribbed stems and leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are edible and have a slightly tart flavor, making it a useful plant in some cuisines. It is well adapted to hot, dry environments and requires minimal water to thrive.
